titleStmt.title: Grant Green to James F. Robinson
CWG8715

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky,
Frankfort, 20th Feby, 1863.
, Esq.:
Dear Sir:
Govr Robinson
Sir

In the case of the Commonwealth vs the Sheriff of Butler Co. (Jno A Hayes & his sureties) for $2416 30/100 principal & $483 26/100 Damages, balance revenue for 1861 the whole amount has been paid on an execution by Mr Hays & his Sureties, except the damages -- I think the Damages should be remitted, as Mr Hays did not have time to collect before his death, and a larger portion of the principal entrust & costs ^was paid^ by his securities.

Franklin Cir. Ct
$483.26 } Damages
Jno. A. Hayes
Shff
Remission Issd Feby 20. 1863
